creditline: Gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky, the David and Margaret Christenson Endowment for Art Acquisition, and the Earl S. and Barbara Flanagan Sanford Fund for the Purchase of American Art
description: colorful abstract canvas comprised of geometric and organic shapes and patterns; in simple frame painted bright green
medium: Oil on canvas with artist's painted frame
signed: verso across bottom stretcher, black ink: PANOPLY  Roscoe Mitchell  1967
text: "Panoply" is a word that means a complete and impressive collection of things. That is an apt title for Roscoe Mitchell's painting, a densely packed universe of color, patterm, shape, and form. The range of textures and images in the picture push to the edge, where the artist's painted frame tames their frenzy with a solid green border. Mitchell is one of the most influential free-jazz musicians and composers of the last fifty years. It is tempting to imagine music pouring forth from the picture.
title: Panoply
